FuncDef:
The ptp send-gm-wtr command sets the wait-to-restore (WTR) time for the local device to send announce messages carrying GM attributes after the time server recovers.
The undo ptp send-gm-wtr command sets the WTR time to 0. The default WTR time is 0, that is, the function is disabled.
By default, the WTR time is 0, that is, the function is disabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the WTR time for a device to send announce messages carrying GM attributes.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 720, in minutes.

Examples: Warning: This configuration will slow down the speed of PTP source switch.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This function is disabled by default. You are advised to deploy this function on the device directly connected to the time source server with unstable output time performance. The WTR time should be longer than the fault recovery period of the time server.
Precautions
This configuration increases the TOPO switching time of PTP time synchronization. Therefore, you are not advised to use this function in scenarios where you expect to quickly perform PTP time synchronization TOPO switching. It is recommended that this configuration be deployed on a device directly connected to an unstable time source server. The configured time must be a little longer than the fault flapping period of the time server.
